description:
I'm from out of town and I was looking on Google maps for a pizza place near by that had a affordable price. I got to say I was skeptical about how big the pizza was going to be. 

I ordered a large Haight pizza and added pepperoni and sausage to it. Man was I impressed the delivery was on time, the delivery guy was very polite, the pizza was very tasty, and big. No complaints whatsoever, I definitely recommend this place for great pizza.
author: Casey L.

description:
Good pizza, but they got my order wrong :( 

I was really excited for the deep dish Mythic pizza I ordered, but they just sent over a regular Mythic pizza instead (which is less expensive than the deep dish too, even though I was charged for the deep dish). The order also took nearly an hour. 

The pizza itself was decent, but really heavy (the box felt like a weight to carry) and dense.
author: Alice Z.

description: HANDS DOWN THE BEST PIZZA IN THE CITY. If I could eat here everyday I would. It's open late, it's cheap, and you will not find more mouth watering, fresh pizza then this. I may have them cater my wedding... who knows
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Hands down - best pizza I've had in the city thus far. Mind you, I'm the type of person who just wants some pizza, some good ol' pizza. I don't need it to be bougie with a bunch of weird toppings, hard crust and stingy sauce. 

Every pizza that I've ordered looks straight out of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. Cheesy, greasy, saucy and the crust is so delicious. I normally don't eat me crust, but this was so good that I inhaled the whole thing. Lots of happy coworkers when we get from this place. Photo for reference - those savages dug in right away.

It's also free delivery! Definitely reaching for their phone number when I'm dying for some pizza
author: Marissa B.

description: Generous toppings and so many slice options. Would definitely come again. I loved the Tijuana slide I just had!
author: Rachel C.

description: The team behind this pizzeria is the nicest in the neighborhood. You gotta try a slice of Haight. Highly recommended!!
author: Jérémie R.

description: Stop by for a late night snack, the service was fast and friendly. They were very helpful. The slices kinda looked like they might have been sitting there for a while. But we got a slice of cheese and added toppings and ordered a small pizza and wings. The slice was just ok, don't think I would order it again. The pizza that I ordered and that was made fresh was really good. I would come back here again and order a fresh pizza for take out. The wings were just ok.
author: Ron V.

description: This pizza was absolutely delicious! I got a veggie slice that was LOADED with cheese, bell peppers, mushrooms and onions! I added a ton of chili flakes to it and devoured it! The slice is a good size for the price, its a great place to stop for a quick bite or some late night pizza! The place itself is right between two bars, so I imagine it gets really busy late at night! Its a small space, so I wouldn't be surprised if there isnt any seating when it gets more crowded. The people behind the counter were really nice and seemed to bring out the pizzas for some bigger groups who were sitting there. Overall, I would definitely come here again! Great prices and quick service!
author: Kulmeher D.

description: The crust was light and airy,sauce was good and pizza was delicious. We ordered a deep dish pepperoni and it came out in about 20 minutes. The small is good enough for 4 I would say. Little hole in the wall kind of place.
author: Shaneel R.

description:
Hands down best pizza joint in SF!

Plenty of cheese and ingredients rather than the usual dry and seldom toppings pizza. My favorite is the Hawaiian but I've tried many others and have yet to be disappointed! Wonderful service, super friendly guys!

Place is open late for late night snack /post night out  carb cravings best satisfied here!
author: Oxana K.

description: The Vegan Pizza was pretty good, service was pleasant and quick. Great "hole in a wall" that will surprise you with taste! I will return.
author: maryann t.

description: One of the best pizza I ever try!! I come all the way from Daly City just for a slide of pizza!! They have unique names for their pizza. Why i like is that they have slides not just the whole pizza!!!  If you like crispy crust you will love it here!! The take of the dough has a great taste! The best thing is that they make it on the moment is not been frozen or been there warm for a long time!   The people in there are sooo nice and very friendly always smiling!! My favorite pizza is the Greco with pesto!!
author: Rosie M.

description:
Great pizza! 

Open late and very friendly. 

10/10 Would recommend to a friend.

Writing more words here to satisfy the help review minimum.
author: John I.

description: Have had pizzas delivered twice now, and I really love their deep dish pizza!  Big pieces, delivered quickly, and really good.
author: Sean R.

description:
Mythic Pizza is my jaaaam! Doesn't matter what part of the city we end up in, this is our go to at the end of the night. Cheese with extra sauce. Yes, please! 

If you're going to get a slice, just go all in and get a small. It's $4.80 more and you get a whole freaking pizza! You know you're going to eat like 53737282 slices anyways. 

There's no counting calories when it comes to Mythic. 

Jimmy is the best!
author: Shereen A.

description: We pre-ordered 6 pizzas to be delivered to our daughter's birthday party today. Everything arrived just as we ordered, double cut slices, thin crust, and the pizza was yummy! A few of the party guests wanted to know where it was from because it was so good. Thanks, Mythic- you fed about 35-40 people today.
author: Amy J.

description:
After hours pizza! Yum yum!
What does it say that I have eaten here 5 days in a row?!?
author: Douglas A.

description: I'm a transplant from NYC where I spent the first few decades of my life so that makes me one of those people who thinks they're a pizza expert. This is not NY pizza, but I realize I have to suspend any expectations of NY pizza goodness when eating pizza in SF. With that being said, Mythic Pizza hits the spot for eat-in or take-out. I love the amount of cheese (deliciously excessive) I get on a combo slice, and the toppings are decent to good quality. For some reason it's quite different when opting for delivery, and not as good. I much prefer to order at the counter, so that's what I always do now and I'm perfectly happy doing it.
author: Russ S.

description: I've been looking for a hole in the wall pizza joint; I think I found it! This place has amazing pizza and friendly service. There was no one around when I ordered-it's more of a late night place. The service was quick. Price was right. I'd recommend this place!
author: Alison J.

description: Mythic is a good stop if you are ambling around late night and want something cheap to wolf down. They load each slice with toppings and cheese until the crust can't support itself. I ordered the Tijuana, which had a ton of sausage, pickled jalapenos, and onions. It wasn't shabby for $5.
author: Huey N.

description:
Bring cash (not cash-only, but don't waste our time), order a slice of Haight, and be smashing savory za in no time. The XL pie will feed a turnt group of dudes no prob.

It's not gourmet, boujee wood-fired shit. It's just solid slices by the same group of nice dudes.
author: Logan S.

description: The best pizza I have tried the slices are so big and cheap its great place to eat if you are a little broke
author: Taha R.

description:
I USED TO LOVE THIS PLACE! Is super close from my house so i would always come here, but what i'm about to tell you guys is why I DO NOT LOVE it anymore...
Thursday night, my friend and ordered a XL pepperoni pizza with extra cheese, because that the type of people we are, they took the time they always do, like 20' but brought the WRONG PIZZA, i called them back and they said "yeah, we'll send you another one, KEEP THAT ONE and the new one is coming" So we were super happy and just jumping around, i mean a pizza for free? my two favorites words in there, anyways...The pizza guy came and he's like "where's the other pizza?" and i'm like "the guy on the phone said it was a gift" and he's like "No, no, no, he would've called me" so i called him because i am 100% SURE HE SAID THAT, even my friend heard it! So i called the pizza place and told him what was happening and he said "No, no, no, no i said that pizza is for other client you need to return it", long story short they made me look like a liar, wanted me to pay for both pizzas(!!!!!!!!) and YELLED at me at my own effing house! He even woke up my baby! RIDONKULUS! You just lost a VERY LOYAL client, and all the people i took there, i feel totally hurt and you guys suck. Yeah, you know who i am.
author: Francisca S.

description: Great pizza by the slice. Cheap. Can be taken out for a beer combo at the NocNoc or enjoyed while waiting for your laundry.
author: Guillaume S.

description: Must've been a Monday when we were meandering through the Haight. Midnight musings made me crave a mushroom & olive slice, Mystic's was neither mammoth, nor miniature, just medium in size. A messy mountain of cheese, a meager mound of toppings, a mishmash of mediocrity in my mouth. Moderately priced, a mere $4, much value for your money. Might return, but the likelihood is marginal. Masters of marvelous comestibles they are not.
author: Fancypants X.

description: They told me one price and charged me something totally different? It didn't make any since. They didn't own up to their normal original price they charged me. They gave us horrible service and I'm pretty sure they messed up our order on purpose. Their menu price doesn't match what they have listed. I will not be going to this pizza joint ever again! They are all rude and lie so much! Plus the pizza is not that good.
author: Nick Y.

description: So they dont honer the prices they have on the menu. The worst service ever and when u ask for a manager 3 people came up. Ugh worst experience ever 1st time in San Francisco and this is what happens. :(
author: Edgard Z.

description:
The only reason why I'm setting this as a four star is the location is a little uncomfortable for a suburbian like me, and the place is kind of small so there isn't much room if you plan to eat there with a large group of friends. I would say it could fit 8 people comfortably.

I'm unsure about why other reviewers have 1-starred this mainly because I've had my share of pizza and I've hardly seen a pizza slice this big, with the dough an impressive balance of soft and crunchy yet not breaking the bank when you're looking for a simple late night bite. I had their pesto slice and their Hawaiian. Maybe once the toppings get more complex and heavy the pizza doesn't hold on its own, so I'll come back and try more toppings to see if it holds up and is consistent.

The staff even late at night was patient, and it didn't take too long for them to whip together a fresh slice from the oven for me. They have Costco-sized chili pepper and parmesan cheese readily available if you're into those add-ons for pizza. They do put a very generous amount of what I think is mozzarella cheese, and it does look like they don't integrate the toppings into the dough. It's more placed on top than baked in, but still delicious nevertheless.

Verdict: Coming back, if I'm looking for a quick and dirty yet satisfying slice of pizza while I'm in the area.
author: Michelle R.

description: This place is completely underrated. For a late night slice this place is perfect! They load up the cheesiness on all their pizzas. People who work here are really nice too.  They have plenty of the toppings you'd ever want on the counter, and even have italian seasoning which is something that was so tasty on my pizza but I haven't seen elsewhere. Bonus, the price is reasonable! 2 slices for under $10? Yes please!
author: Monica G.

description:
My love for the sandwich shop nearby, "love and haight" brought me to try this place on a late night before driving back to my town.

I was excited for this place. It's veg friendly with various exciting options.  I took it to go for the road and what do you kno. As I bit into my slice all I tasted was a smoky burnt taste.  The bottom of my pizza tasted burnt. Although it was packed with toppings... I propose the pizzas are half cooked then extra toppings are added and it's baked again fully.  That's kinda gross.

The pizza was burnt and I was disappointed to the max. Never going there again when I visit. Better to stick to the basics and "Love and Haight" sandwich shop owns this heart.
author: Mypang T.

description: Ordered a slice of sausage. Pizza was burnt & cheese was runny. Not worth the money at all.
author: Richard J.

description:
Never again. I used to believe that there was no such thing as bad pizza. I have never written a Yelp review (one maybe) because I have never had my morals called into question before. I breath, dream, eat and live pizza. 

All of their slices start as cheese and they glop toppings on and put in the oven. Not the kiss of death but less than even your most basic pizza places. By this time there is sooooo much cheese on that motherfucker. Again, might be okay, but... it's not good cheese.

I go to pick up the slice and one side of the crust splits perpendicular to the crust. My faith wavers. I scoot down the slice and guess what? It fucking happens again. What the heck and half of Georgia. I would eat two slices of any pizza. I left a mush of cheese and bullshit crust on my plate and now my stomach hurts. 

Save your time, money and faith in pizza. Go to Escape from New York or if you can travel get your game on at Golden Boy or Tony's. 

Worst pizza ever. Come on, Lower Haight. We can do better.
author: Cathleen B.

description:
If you need a late night, cheesy grease pocket to soak up that Lower Haight alcohol collection you've amassed, look no further than Mythic Pizza. In all seriousness, it was a very tasty slice, miles better than Cybelle's or Nizario's or Oz or any of those other terrible pizza joints that inexplicably have more stars than this one. 

Sort of expensive, but if you stick to cheese you're only out $3. Go for it.
author: Andres B.

description:
My review is about the delivery service and not necessarily the pizza itself. 

I ordered pizza from Mythic Pizza in San Francisco through the Yelp app on my phone, which I have done a number of times. The estimated time for delivery was 45-60 minutes, and I got home about 25 minutes after ordering, around 2am. When I arrived at my house, there was a car waiting outside of my building with its flashers on, which I thought nothing of since I was early for the delivery time. I walked up my steps and began to fish for my keys. Mind you, I'm female, alone and it's the middle of the night. I looked over my shoulder and realized that the delivery person was there, but there were two men approaching me.  One guy gave me the pizza, and the other pulled out a crumpled print out and started pointing at the word "cash" and stating the word tip very loudly over and over. 

Besides the fact that all of this is done through the app, their appearance was extremely intimidating and I was worried for my safety. I was cornered at my door in the middle of the night, with a pizza being delivered by two aggressive men, which I have never had happen before. It made be nervous even to put my keys in the door as I wasn't sure of their intent.  I told them I did not have any cash and waited for them to move away, which they did, but the whole experience was intimidating and scary. Additionally, and likely not coincidentally, I had another friend also order from the same place at the same time and the SAME thing happened to her with her delivery - two guys demanding cash in a very aggressive manner. It could not have been the same people as I live in NOPA and she's in the Mission, and our pizzas were delivered at the same time.

I will not be ordering through Yelp nor from Mythic again in the future as I do not believe this is a safe delivery service, and wanted to share here so that others may be aware.
author: Elizabeth W.

description: You know it's bad pizza when you are drunk and the pie still isn't good. I don't know wtf is going on in the lower height but nobody makes thin crust pizzas. Get on it
author: Yoshi V.

description:
Athens pizza is totally the way to go.. well, at least if you like artichokes and pesto.

Mythic pizza is the perfect late night (and, quite frankly, any time of the day) pizza place in the Lower Haight. The cheese is ooey and gooey and the pizza stays hot for a while (so you can pick it up and eat it while walking back home).

They have pizzas with the standard toppings, but I think where they shine is the specialty pizzas. I am a huge fan of their Athens pizza, which is topped with artichoke hearts, pesto, and white cheese. Slices are each under $5 (there may be a couple of exceptions) and the quality is amazing.

If you're hanging around one of the bars around the Lower Haight and are in need for those late night carbs, definitely check this place out. Your stomach (and drunchies) will be very happy with you!
author: Julia N.

description:
Let me preface this by saying I've been ordering from Mythic for YEARS. The pizza is good and affordable. But when your pizza delivery leaves you concerned about your safety, it's time to find a new favorite. 

Out of my last 3 orders, 2 left me feeling at best disappointed, and at worst, scared. Order #1 took place on a Sunday afternoon. Est Delivery time was 45-60 minutes. After an hour and a half, the pizza hadnt arrived. I called 5 times and kept being told "it would be here soon" with no explanation. After 2+ hours it arrived, and the guy had a car full of friends. The pizza was cold. I called and asked to speak to the manager and kept being told he doesn't take calls from customers. Eventually they gave me his cell number and I got my pizza refunded. Whatever. 

This Saturday, I ordered pizza through Yelp/Eat24 and was told it would arrive within 60 minutes. I waited 90 minutes, no pizza. I called, and the pizza magically "arrived," with two guys waiting outside my apartment demanding a tip, yelling in my face. It was about 1:45 am, and I am a woman, alone, with two men standing outside my apartment threatening me. They were waving a paper in my face, "proving" that I needed to pay them a tip in cash. I refused, called my boyfriend, and eventually they left. Strangely (or perhaps not, since it seems to be common practice), this exact situation happened with a friend of mine this same weekend.

It's a shame... pizza is supposed to lift you up! Not make you feel hungry due to a 2+ hour delivery, harassed and afraid. No pizza is THAT good.
author: Leslie W.

description:
very fast & excellent size slices

I always get the mushroom, jalapeño, pineapple slice..
great price! 


very cool guys behind the counter!
author: Edwin G.

description: The best pizza by the slice in the area. I recommend it to anyone in the neighborhood because they've got a great selection and good ingredients.
author: Shawn T.

description:
its cheap its local and they are nice. Its not trendy, organic and its too salty. But its close to home its cheap and they are nice. Never hada problem with  the delivery service. 
If you order through an app maybe the app people deliver?  Call direct. I am loyal and now overweight fan.
author: Kathleen G.

description: Mythic Pizza may have changed their name to Mystique Pizza, perhaps to distinguish themselves from their Haight Street Counterpart? But that's the thing about this place, their pizza is good, that they don't even have to have predicable hours. I think maybe they are trying to change that by just opening late after 5pm everyday...All I know is that their pizza is the best I've tried out here. Their 6th St/Haight (it's the same toppings, but with different names depending on if you get it by the slice or as a whole pie), has all the toppings I love from artichoke hearts to pesto and tomatoes. If you catch this place open, say after visiting the clubs next door or across the street, Mythic is the place to eat. Expect colorful character to talk to you or offer to draw your picture if you eat inside or spend any time standing around outside.
author: Steve N.

description:
1:50pm - We've order here a thousand times will no problems and today it's been almost 2 hours and we still haven't received our pizza. Called after an hour an a half and they said it should arrive any minute, after 15 min passed we called again and they didn't give us an apology or even give us an update or reason why it's taking so long. While typing this, they still have not delivered it.

2:05pm - Still no pizza. Called again and put on hold and ignored. Asked to speak to the manager and he said he wasn't there. 

2:10pm - Received pizza. Driver was with a friend in his car, which was weird. 

2:12pm - Pizza is cold, drinks are warm, salad is soggy. Called asked to speak to a manager, said the manager would call us back on his phone within 10 min.

2:26pm - No manager call. Called the driver to ask him why he was so late since the manager hasn't called. Driver couldn't give us one. Driver said the manager has called but no missed call on our end. 

2:29pm - Manager finally called. Finally received an apology. Offered us a refund. He was very nice. Definitely the one shining light on the whole experience.
author: Mickle N.

description: They've been around for 30 years and the pizza is still terrible! You'd think in all this time they'd have figured out how to do a better job.
author: Manny F.

description: We're from Chicago so we're pizza snobs but YUM! I ordered by the slice The Greco (mushrooms, feta cheese and black olives) and it was delicious! The ingredients were fresh, tasty sauce and good ratio of cheese to sauce. Also the service was efficient and friendly. HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!
author: Julie K.

description:
I've been going here for years.  One of the best pepperoni pies in the city.  If you order a slice, get the tijuana and substitute pepperoni for the sausage.

Delivery has always been quick for me and the crew is super chill.  It's a pizza spot, so don't get too ambitious and try the supporting bites (i.e. Wings).
author: Zibbie N.

description: While I find that many patrons come from the bars across the street, Mythic Pizza boasts a customizable pizza menu with plenty of options. While I find that many people seem to like the place, I have found that the flavor and the dough failed to be more than just home made pizza. Knowing how many options I have in the area, I have continued to opt out of Mythic Pizza after my first try. I just can't say it was anything special, which included the wait time for a pizza nor the customer service.
author: Mohib Q.

description:
I frequent this pizza shop far too much. I've had all the toppings now and always go back for the mushroom. It's great value and so DELICIOUS. 

The guys who run the place are all very trustworthy after leaving a credit card behind one time after too many beers, and are always friendly. Really good affordable pizza that never seems to disappoint!
author: Jonathan G.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and have ordered pizza for delivery quite often from Mythic.  I order the same thing every week.  My wife and friends and I enjoy it.   Mediocre pizza, but hey, it's pizza.  

Last week, I ordered my usual and the guy delivered a pizza with the wrong toppings.   (The pizza had feta cheese and my wife is allergic to it).  I called back and was told I would have a "credit."   He guy provided no name and would not refund my money, just the credit.  

So, here we are on Friday night, I called in for my "credit" pizza.   I was told unless I had the name of the delivery driver, they would not give me my "credit" pizza.   In fact, I was given attitude and made to feel like I was scamming them.  

I told them I have spent hundreds of dollars and am very displeased with the service.   Then hung up.  

They called back several minutes later and offered to send me my pizza.   Ummmm, no thanks.   Keep your spit-upon pizza.  My wife and I will NEVER order from there again.
author: Kelton B.

description:
the pizza here is fucking bomb. and thats not just a drunk girl saying that. like that shit is so good. the haight. get a slice of the haight. with a lil ranch. you'll be happy you did it. 
have fun. 
boom.
author: Isabel B.

description: Mythic Pizza was exactly what I needed. I got Hawaiian slice and pesto slice, all the ingredient ratios were perfect, and they had every topping you could want. Would definitely go back.
author: Andrew T.

description:
My husband and I went in San Francisco for a concert, then we decided to have some slices of pizza. We found this "Mythic Pizza". 
Well, I have to say... pizza was so good! Cheap and good! Good baked, good cheese, good ingredients and kind staff. 
Oh, we are vegetarians and they have many options for vegetarians. We took "Haight" and "Cheese". They were sooo goood! 
Trust me, I'm Italian! :D 
Obviously it is not Italian style but it was good! (better than Domino's or Pizza Hut of course). 
In brief, I recommend this place.
author: Scilla L.

description: If you come here, make sure they charge you appropriately as they like to charge more than the price listed on the menu.
author: Dipesh G.

description: We are currently in mythic with all the stools up on the counter, tables cleaned off and way past their closing time. They were cashing out and re-opened to sell us a slice. They had 5 left and we took them all. Best ever.
author: Mark G.

description:
Bad. This is a business based upon scamming drunk hungry patrons. They have no -ZERO-passion for food. The pizza sucks. It's almost flavorless. 

One guy takes your order (and complains if you order too quickly in English). The other guy takes your cash (only) and banters with the other guy in Spanish, barely acknowledging you as he takes your cash in exchange for a cardboard-like slice of shit.

And the kids don't notice or give a shit, I guess.
author: Kevin E.

description:
DIRTY!  
If you're going to take my order and touch the cash register and who knows what else  ....and then go directly to making that pizza and touching the toppings without cleaning your hands first, I AM DONE!  
Just give me my money back!
I just threw up in my mouth after witnessing this several times while I was waiting for my pizza.

NOT GOING BACK!
author: Little E.

description:
Care for some rich - overloaded with cheese - greasy pizza?! 

Mythic Pizza is next door to my favorite bar in SF, Toronados. After a night of drinking some good brew we were starving for something savory & cheap. We walked in next door... ordered a few slices and we were set. I could barely finish a piece - so much cheese! Every inch of that pizza was scrumptious! Service is slow & not the friendliest, but most pizza joints are (to-go service/call-in orders)

I was staying in the Haight/Ashbury neighborhood so I was happy I found this little spot. Definitely check it out if you're in the area.
author: Juanita D.

description: No doubt this place is the "go to" pizza spot in the Lower Haight. The slice I ordered was very delicious. It was served on a paper plate like most pizza drop in locations. In an earlier review someone mentioned that this was just an average place.  The ambiance is just that. So I added an extra star to seal the deal. I would go here again and be content with the surroundings. This pizza location is surrounded by good taste bars with. Enormous beer taps and cool people. You won't be disappointed unless the cooks have an attitude!!
author: Nate C.

description:
**late night review**

Don't do it.  Don't do it!!   Don't be tempted by the toppings!

They do something really strange when you add toppings.  They take an already made cheese slice, add a ton of toppings, add more shredded cheese & then put in the oven (the same thing that only warms, already cooked slices).  

Sounds great right?  Lots of toppings & extra cheese?  It's not.  Instead you get this under-cooked mushy mess of grossness.  It's really not pleasant to the mouth, on all levels.  

However!  With the plain cheese, you avoid that pitfall.  And voila!  Not bad for 2 am pizza.  


p.s. if you ever end up dropping said pizza on the ground, cheese side down, when trying to get into your house..... all bets are off.   Oh... and reheating it to "kill all the nasties" doesn't quite work...  sure fire tummy ache in the am....  = (
author: CatwomanRoar M.

description: This is a good place to grab a quick slice of pizza but its nothing special. Got a all meat and pepperoni slice. Pizza was fresh which was good but for 8.50 for two standard sjze slices I'd rather go to escape ny or another pizza place.
author: Josue V.

description: Got the special for with a Large Pizza and the buffalo wings for $24, seriously delicious pizza. Had pepperoni and feta, but would have been just as happy with a cheese. Noted that they were voted best cheese pizza. Will eat here again!
author: Kuhray V.

description: I was feeling lazy, and this joint was right beside my front door so I ignored the bad Yelp reviews and ventured forth. Mistakes were made. It might have been an alright slice of pizza if it had actually been cooked. It was soggy and cold in the middle. Will not be returning.
author: David B.

description: These guys have a bad rap. For some reason your scores are low? And all I have to say is it's the cheapest pizza in lower Haight area.  Yes, it's not that great and the customer Service is subpar.... But... It's cheap.  What do you expect???  Every any other "small" pizza in the area is $18.  Here you can get 3 HUGE SLICES FOR LESS THAN $15
author: Justin G.

description: My sister-in-law told me about this place. We had to visit when we were in SF over the summer. We gave the Athens pizza and the Haight a try. I felt the pesto and oil in the pizzas was overwhelming and it was literally dripping oil when I was trying to eat it. I also thought the cheese was more than we could handle. The ingredients were fresh but those things turned me off.
author: Varun Y.

description: This place has something for everyone: for people who want to eat decent pizza (I mean, we're not in New York, but...) it has decent pizza; for people who want to complain, they have plenty to find, it seems.  Some people think it's gross, and maybe some of the combinations don't quite mesh, but leastwise the Athens is real good.
author: Scott R.

description:
I used to love this pizza place and it was my go to for delivery. The pizza seemed fresh and gooey and delicious and I even recommended it to my friends. Well that is all over now. 

I placed my order last night and after waiting over an hour for it finally got a status update that it should "be there in a few minutes". 15 minutes later and nothing, while I'm checking on the status for a second time the food arrives. The driver shoves my order into my hands and walked away with none of the utensils or extras that I had requested or the bag that they automatically charged  me for (if you're not from SF there are bag fees).

Upon being "given" my food I realize that it is cold. Not warm. COLD. Even the bottom of the box is cold and it certainly wasn't in any sort if heat saving carrier - mind you this restaurant is 1mile from where I am. I open the box and the pizza is congealed, dry, and disgusting and the wings are cold, hardly what I would call "hot wings" and also congealed to their foil which I had to peel them off of to eat. 

When I complained I was told they would give me $5 off and even if I wanted new food it would still take an hour and 45 minutes and would be cold again.

Yes, that is what they TOLD me. I will never offer this horrible restaurant my patronage again or ever recommend them. Not to mention this order ended up making me THROW UP later that night and I'm still feeling queasy this meaning.

Thanks a lot Mythic pizza!! Hopefully this review helps others stay clear of this horrific place.
author: Kat L.

description: Don't go for customer service -- that's why me and my boyfriend order delivery. He's a regular -- good pepperoni pizza. Haven't found better unless I make a trip to north beach to Tony's which is to die for!! This works in lieu of that for sure.
author: Neal B.

description: Mythic pizza is a perfect late-night joint when you just want a quick bite. We dropped by for a bite after a fun-filled night at the Church of 8 Wheels. The Haight pizza is really good- even for non-vegetarians! Love the combination of pesto and garlic. It's pretty quick and easy to walk up to the counter and order a slice of pizza for around $4.50. No long lines. There's also not much seating inside, and it's more of a stand up and eat or take it to go type of place. The pizza crust didn't blow my mind, but the dough was quite crispy on the bottom, and they really slathered the pizza with cheese. They also accept credit card, which is great when you don't have spare cash on hand after a long night.
author: Audrey L.

description:
I'm a vegetarian, and I went nuts for this spot.

I had a veggie slice and a Haight slice, and the Haight slice was really, really good.  Open late and relatively reasonably priced.

Also, everyone I know called it "Mystic Pizza", but whatever its called, I would definitely come back.
author: Max P.

description: Friendly service, tasty pizza, comes out quickly, although perhaps slightly burnt. The freshness of the toppings is questionable, but it's perfect for those late night drunk munchies.
author: Hannah C.

description: Just had two slices of pesto pizza. It's basically sub par tomato cheese pizza with pesto gop squeezed on top. Nasty!
author: Patrick D.

description:
They say there's no such thing as bad pizza. This is where you come to test that hypothesis. Wonderbread-like crust, gloopy cheese (a lot of it), and mostly-raw toppings. It's the kind of pizza that takes you back to your college cafeteria.

Most by-the-slice places just offer three or four options -- cheese, pepperoni, and a specialty or two. Mythic sells thirteen kinds of pizza by the slice. While waiting in line, I wondered how they had so many pizzas ready to go. Did they have a back room somewhere with rows and rows of pizza waiting under heat lamps? My theory is that they really just have a bunch of cooked, untopped pizzas waiting; when you order, they pile on the toppings and throw it in the oven until the cheese melts. I got two slices, and it was hard to tell where the Veggie ended and the Mystic began.

On the plus side, the slices are pretty massive. One slice ($3-$5) will probably be all you want to eat.
author: Nath A.

description:
Is this the best pizza on the face of the earth? Of course not. In fact, it barely falls into the gray are of the old adage "sex is a lot like pizza..." because honestly, even their best slices can be pretty lackluster. And at a price point of $4 per slice, it's hard to justify eating here any other time than when you're completely shitfaced and need something to soak up the belly full of Fernet you're stumbling around with. But with that being said, *an* option for late night eats is better than no option at all... so Mythic does a pretty great job of filling a void in the marketplace.

They have all of the standard variations you'd expect, but what I really dig about these cats is that they have a by-the-slice option for us wacky vegan types! The slice is loaded with all sorts of veggies: mushrooms, onions, tomatoes, peppers, olives, etc... all devoid of any cheese whatsoever. And because there aren't very many plant-based eaters coming in for drunk munchies, their slices are made to order and haven't been sitting under a heat lamp for hours on end and simply reheated in the pizza oven. It's about as perfect a situation you can ask for, frankly.

It bears repeating that you really need to lower your expectations if you choose to eat here, after hours or otherwise. In fact, I'd go as far as to suggest you should probably only settle on Mythic if Love 'n Haight is closed next door. You've been warned!
author: Ruggy J.

description: Pizza that hits the spot when your buzzed or drunk.  It's conveniently located next to the bars.  They get you the pizza as quickly to you as possible.  I waited like 2, maybe 3 minutes.  They charge you only like 31 cents for credit card.  I like this place.
author: Shinobi K.

description:
Delivered to us at 2am on a Thursday night! 

Pizza was ok, not too greasy but the toppings were laid under the cheese, making the cheese slide off the pizza very easily.
author: Melissa C.

description: I was a little drunk when I went here, so the pizza was delicious. I'm sure that if I came here sober... Meh. But I like the fact they were open late! Great post-drinking spot to grab a bite!
author: John H.

description: Pluses? They're open until 3am, and they do really quick slices. Cons? The slices aren't that good, and the clientele can be unsavory. They also don't have any red pepper flake shakers. The cheese slice is only $2.50, so it's reminiscent of NY, but that's about where the relations end. The dough is really thick and chewy, and the cheese is light. The tomato sauce is almost non-existent, and when you try the Brooklyn fold on it, the crust just breaks. So sad.
author: Danny C.

description:
Gross.

This was my first slice of pizza in san francisco after moving across the country from Brooklyn, and I guess I should have known better. 

In hindsight, I most likely stopped in out of some misplaced 'slice nostalgia', which was promptly greeted with a reheated piece of cardboard with a few strands of godawful cheese on top. I had to leave a note to 'drunk jake' telling him to make sure to avoid this place late at night, too.

There's some great neapolitan brick oven pizza in SF, and some awesome chicago style pizza in SF, but I have yet to find a good new york slice... and now I'm kind of scared to even try.
author: Jake D.

description:
I give one star for service and three stars for quality of the food.  

I ordered a half and half pizza through seamless.com.  I usually use eat24 but for some reason the restaurant only delivers to my house through seamless.  There was some confusion about my order because of a glitch in the seamless.com phone app.  I used the 1/2 symbol to mean "half" and it showed up as "12" on the order.  What I got was a pizza with ham, pineapple, sausage, and mushrooms, instead of half Hawaiian and half sausage and mushroom.  

I called the pizza place to complain and request a new pizza because I did not want all of the ingredients over all of the pizza.  The person I spoke with yelled at me and refused to help.  The pizza was weird, but very good quality.  I would like to order from here again but I think they would spit in my pizza.  Anyone that is aggressive enough to yell at me would be capable of spitting on my pizza.   

I called seamless.com and they sided with the pizza place and not me.  They didn't believe me.  I eventually spoke to a manager and got the cost of the pizza credited to my account.  

So, if you order pizza from here, don't use seamless.com and don't ask for anything remotely complicated.  Neither seamless.com nor Mythic Pizza is capable of an order as complicated as a half and half pizza.
author: Katherine S.

description:
Mythic pizza...  if I come to you in the later afternoon evening, I get a perfectly done, well balanced slice of pizza.   But in the evening, when I really need a perfect slide, why do I always end up with a soggy, overloaded slice of pizza with undercooked ingredients and soggy cheese.   Half the time, I feed those sloppy wet slices to my dog and feel totally ripped off because this could have been totally avoided if they put in few toppings and let it cook more.

For the day trippers, I'd say go for the Haight or Veggie slice.    After 8pm, stick to the safe options like pepperoni or plain cheese.
author: Yas E.

description:
Yeah Mythic! My friends and I always come here late at night. The slices are huge! No sharing allowed. I recommend you try:

Mythic - pepperoni, salami, mushroom, onion, bell pepper, sausage.

The Haight Pizza - pesto, spinach, mushroom, tomato, garlic, fresh parmesan. 

Or make your own! 

Every time I come here, there is never a line and not too long of a wait. It's right next to Toronado, an awesome dive bar offering an absurd number of beers. The pizza place is just the right size with a couple of tables and ideal for takeout or delivery. Apart from the pizzas, they have other options such as calzones, salads, and deep dish pizzas. 

My boyfriend and I have delivered pizza from here using the Eat24 app at 2am on a Saturday and it arrived quickly and was melting hot. The small is a good size and comes out to be $15 online. You can never go wrong with the pizza here, it's cheap, fast, meaty, and delicious, check it out!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
By far the best pizza by the slice restaurant I have ever gone to. I usually get specialty pizzas there, and as a result I don't get reheated pizzas they make me a fresh slice right there and the cheese and topping are intermixed in such a way that the toppings don't slide off the pizza.

Caveat: if you are sharing a pie with someone who doesn't like a particular topping it will be almost impossible to remove that topping as a result of their method of topping the pizza.
author: Peter G.

description:
Something about those late night munchies that has me browsing through my Yelp app to find my post bar meal. I'm one of those people that believe pizza can never truly be bad. Pizza is pizza and i was ecstatic that this so called "Mythic Pizza" place was open at 2am. Parking was pretty easy and i saw a bunch of people crowded around Mythic and the bar next door. 

I had a slice of the Haight with it's appetizing pesto, spinach, mushroom, garlic, tomato and parmesan. It's a great combo to put together and i would have rated it higher if it were cooked hot enough. A small portion of my pizza tasted a little colder than it should be and i like my cheese to be oozing hot. It wasn't the most amazing pizza but they packed on the toppings and i still left satisfied.
author: Samantha L.

description: If you're like me, and you're out at night, and maybe you've had some alcohol, Mythic Pizza always sounds like a good idea. And it almost always is.
author: Ben H.

description: This is the only yelp review I will ever write. This is the worst pizza I have ever had in my entire life. Thank you.
author: Jake G.

description:
They pile on a mountain of toppings on their specialty pizzas and when I say mountain I mean mountain. I like the Haight which is chock full of vegetables. 

It's probably not the best pizza in town...well it's not the best pizza in town but it's pretty good. And it's an unusual pizza experience if nothing else.
author: Brittany N.

description: The pizza & wings are really more around 3 stars in terms of quality, but for the price (if you use one of their combo deals) it's pretty damn good for what you get. Sometimes I don't want to break the bank for some decent pizza and wings, and this place does the trick.
author: Katie S.

description: take out was fast,  efficient, and delicious. Garlic bread was a good size too. Good price for the amount of food! Would order from here again.
author: Stephanie H.

description: I honestly only eat here after a night of drinking in the lower haight. Don't bother ordering from here. Pay extra to get pizza somewhere else. Perfect place to fill you up when you're drunk and craving pizza (mainly because there are no other pizza joints in the area), but definitely not a place I'd go to order a pie sober. The extra star is for being open late night, when it's too late to get food anywhere else.
author: Cody M.

description: The pizzas looked really good in the pictures, as well as when they delivered it, but it wasn't AMAZING. Ordered two custom halves and halves. In terms of the Hawaiian, the pineapple looked pale, and the sauce was a bit too sweet. The cheese could use a bit more taste too. Other than that, it's pizza, we'll eat it anyway, hahah.
author: Bahar A.

description:
If 0 (zero) stars were an option on yelp that's what this dump would get...  This place sucks, the pizza sucks.  

Poor, rude and surly service, pizza is extremely doughy, and undercooked.  Not tasty at all.

Terrible.
author: Matt C.

description:
You gotta get the haight. Need to come back sober to double check though.
Perfect for the munchies!!
author: Sebastian P.

description: Frikkin awesome ! Was there during a weekday afternoon got a couple of plain slices and want to say mythic pizza is awesome ! I was really hungry of course !
author: Abraham L.

description:
I find it interesting that the only people who give this cesspit 3 or more stars are alcoholics who had to make a late night stop one night for something to absorb all the booze.

Try visiting this place sober. Removing that drunken haze reveals a fairly dirty eating area, rude service, and a constant stream of drunks screaming into their cell phones, tossing one another into the walls, arguing with the cashier, groping their date's ass, and stuffing their limp mouths with really sub-par pizza.

"It'll fill your belly."    This weird compromise comes up an awful lot in other reviews. Lots of things will fill your belly. Many of them you don't necessarily want in your gutty works. Concrete, for example. Or big handfuls of fertilizer. Or toenail clippings. The pizza here is marginally better than those random items... but there are plenty of other, better places to get pizza that are not all that far from Mythic and you'd do well to walk the extra blocks to get there.

On the other hand, if you don't live in the Lower Haight and only come down to that neighborhood, dressed like an asshole, to people-watch from inside the Noc Noc and then require something solid before your liver blows straight out of your torso, eat here because they seem to cater to your type. Jackass.
author: J. S.

description: This place does not have a dipping sauce. I ordered a slice of Haight pizza which was pretty good. They made the slice pretty fast.
author: Harshal J.

description:
Location, Location, Location. This place is only worth mentioning because of its location. Their lease is worth it because it's definitely located for your convenience when the drunk munchies hit after you've been drinking in the Lower Haight. The majority of their business must come during these times. I couldn't imagine people stopping here for a slice in the middle of the day.

I ordered a slice with pesto and ricotta. I was disappointed since it wasn't a true pesto slice. They simply drizzled pesto on top of a pre-made cheese slice, so there was tomato sauce and pesto. Adding ricotta as a topping definitely made it a little better. 

In conclusion, I'm no better or worse for ordering from here. It was very mediocre and forgettable. I wouldn't order from here if other places were open, but I can't say I wouldn't get a slice from here again if it was the only spot open late at night.
author: Rebecca G.

description:
Maybe it's because I had a few beers in my system & I hadn't had any solid food all day prior to having a slice of pepperoni & a half a slice of cheese from Mythic, but I thought there pizza was pretty damn tasty. 

I've been by this place a zillion times, but never think to stop in. Well, I was over at Danny Coyle's watching a football game, and since this place is down the street I stopped in at halftime. They sell several different varieties of pizzas by the slice, and most slices are between 3 & 4 bucks. The place was pretty empty when I was there and the guy behind the counter helping me was very nice. He had no problem packing up three individual slices in boxes for me and didn't even mind slicing the one into two smaller slices (I'm assuming the a-hole workers others have mentioned in reviews are those who work the late-night drunken scene). 

As far as the pizza itself, I honestly didn't think it was all that bad. I actually thought the crust was quite good (chewy, not too thin, but not too thick, and fresh). Sure, the cheese was greasy but given the circumstances I really didn't care. 

I probably wouldn't seek this place out, but if I was in the area, wanted pizza, and I'll be honest...had some in alcohol in me, I wouldn't hesitate to stop in for a slice of pizza.
author: George A.

description:
Okay... This place serves up some super-filling, fairly fresh veggie pizza.  I just had the Haight pizza and the tomatoes were fresh and flavorful.  I was impressed. 

This is not high-end pizza, but very satisfying... especially late at night.  They seem to have the base of the pizza precooked - and then throw on the toppings and another layer of cheese.... their pizzas never taste like they've been in the heat lamp for hours.  You can actually pay with CC if your order is over 8 bucks (two big slices).  I would probably be a lot skinner if that was one slice.  

One bit of feedback, their customer area always looks a little grubby and disheveled... much like my neighborhood of the Lower Haight.  They are next to two bars, so I can understand how it's hard to keep it tidy.  Also... the ben behind the counter always have the most painfully depressed expressions on their face.  I mean.. maybe they're just being real... folding pizza boxes is rarely a life calling.  But it does make me feel like I'm troubling them when I order or continuing their misery by giving money  the establishment.
author: Eric N.

description:
I wanted to eat for myself and wasn't disappointed.
The guy made the pizza from scratch and that was very fast (10 minutes max.). Although I took the smaller size, it's honestly enough for 2.
The San Francisco pizza is awesome (and you can have it for two people).
author: Lucas D.

description: Except for the annoying person hitting on my daughter I give his chicken sandwich a five star. The person who took my order was super nice. Open late.
author: Gina O.

description:
*in mysterious voice* 

I don't always eat pizza.....but when i do....



its definitely not fukin here. stupid drunkards and their deceived perception throwin off yelpers, hmph!



Edit for clarification: the pizza was so bad I had it wasted once and it was just *ok* 

Gave the rest to roommate's dog 

Of course he loved it =) til the next morning =(
author: Belito L.

description: I live around the corner and go here all the time. The veggie pizza is great and I'm not even vegetarian haha. The pizzas made fresh even the slices, so it's not sitting in front of a window all day.
author: Kalani M.

description:
This pizza was delicious. I am shocked by the average ratings on yelp as this was perhaps my favorite slice of pizza in SF. Or ever. As a native New Yorker, and as I have taken my partner, Brienne (of Tarth), to this establishment, I cannot give a higher recommendation to this pizza joint. 

Best wishes, 
hungry panda 

Ps. Try the Greco or the cheese with olives. Add pepper to taste.
author: Amanda R.

description: Cheap but no flavor and the dough is undercooked. Sucks... was hoping it'd be better. Throwing away my pizza as I write this review.
author: Anna B.

description:
I freaking hate this place.  I went there Saturday night after Madrone.  The owner was a total prick.  I order two Mythic pizza slices and 25 minutes later, after everyone else behind me in line got there slices of pizza I got one slice only (and that's only because a buddy said something) and then I lost it and the mofo, I wanted my money back and the a*&^hole actually had the nerve to say "oh your pizza will be out in a few minutes, don't you want to wait".  I told the a$#hole to give my money.  I'm out.  

Imo, excluding the circumstance above, the pizza is shitty and this is coming from someone that loves pizza and tries to give places a chance to shine.  Mr Pizzaman is better than this place and that's lower than Little Caesars, lol...  If you want a good pizza, go to Pizza Orgasmic in the marina (there open till 2:30 or whenever they run out of pizza) or Pizza My Heart.
author: Mike M.

description:
I usually order delivery from Mythic, in the middle of the night, when I feel like I deserve it (because oh man, it's not low calorie). Specifically, the "Mythic Deep Dish" -- don't forget to ask for extra sauce on it. Thick, huge slices of melty, cheesy, meaty goodness. Fork required. 

I've never been to the restaurant, but their delivery is fast and friendly.  Typically I order using the GrubHub iPhone app. And I get delivery all the time at 2:00 am and later.
author: Philip K.

description:
Straight up for the Price which is Low, this place Rocks!

Huge Chicken Parm Hoagie for $5.50 and a Slice of the Athens Pizza was a good first impression for me. Toppings are Piled On, wow!

Yes I have had Better, but for a decent Slice I can Vouch for this place.

*** For my own future reference, I will just stick to the Pizza here***
author: Michael D.

description: The service was terrible. They dropped my order and gave my slice (same order) to the person behind me in line. I left because I was in a rush and couldn't wait for them to make another slice.  I'm not terribly sorry, the pizza crust looked like cardboard and the amount of cheese they piled on means that one bite is going to be an instant burned mouth roof. $4.00 for nothing, not a bad deal.
author: Isaac Y.

description:
$4.75 for a slice of pizza is pretty steep, but it's totally worth it.  The pizza slices are HUGE and freshly baked - each slice is baked individually right there in front of you.  I got the Haight (spinach, pesto, tomatoes, garlic, mushrooms) - it was the best pesto-ey, gooey cheesy goodness I've ever tasted.  My friend got the pesto chicken pizza.  I'm definitely coming back.  It really hits the spot after a night out (it's open very late).

It's in a slightly shady area (next to biker bars) and there's very little street parking outside or sitting space inside, so plan ahead - you might just want to have someone grab your pizza and eat elsewhere.
author: Bee M.

description:
Perfectly located for all your late night drunk munchie needs. I usually stick with the cheese pizza. The meat lovers is good as well. Their pizza is on the bready side, with a chewy crust. They don't go light on the cheese and everything is always served piping hot with friendly service.

The best part about this place is the people watching. I once bought a homeless woman a slice of pizza here to assuage my liberal San Francisco guilt. She poked the pizza several times to inspect it and walked away, presumably satisfied. 

There was also the time some drunk white guy got into a fight with the owner. My friends and I told his girlfriend to break up with him. I hope she did.
author: Joann T.

description:
Come on, who doesn't love greasy pizza after a night of drinking? 

Must be something seriously wrong with either you or the pizza if you don't. Since I can't find anything wrong with me, or the pizza....guess I'll have to give it 3 stars.
author: Barbara D.

description: I suggest you come here first, as a preemptive strick against the perils that await you in the nightlife of the lower Haight. $4 bucks will buy you a slice with enough feta, pesto, and olives on it to combat even the most deadliest of toxins and late nights.
author: David S.

description:
Well I was hungry
and they gave me pizza in exchange for my money
so that was AWESOME.

I came here with my sister's boyfriend as they saved our table at Molotov's across the street.  We were both buzzed (and also Santas) when he revealed that he would be proposing to my sister over Christmas.

Well, seeing as how he is awesome and my sister is awesome, I was ecstatic.  He reminded me it was a surprise -- but I told some civilian who was standing in line as I bounced around quite jolly.  She congratulated us and also seemed genuinely excited. 

After enjoying our tasty pizza and leaving the bar, some drug dealer kept inviting us to his RV.  We instead climbed a tree (still in our costumes.) When I hear a girl's voice "ohh! that's the guy that said he was going to propose to that girl's sister over Christmas!" which would have been ok, except my sister was standing there taking video of us climbing trees and probably hoping we'd fall out so she could post it on youtube.  Luckily, she's oblivious and didn't hear that...

so if you don't know yet, I now have a future brother in law, and my sister was very very much surprised by the proposal.  So hooray all around!
author: Van W.

description: My friend and I were craving pizza after a night out and we stumbled upon this place. Maybe we have high expectations living a short walk from Escape from NY Pizza on Haight, but this place sucked. We waited 20 minutes for only 2 slices of pizza that really weren't very good. Kinda disappointing, but hey, serves the purpose of a late night snack.
author: Briana B.

description:
After a crazy sweaty night at Vertigo, we stopped to grab a bite at Mythic. 

Thinking I was the smarter of the bunch, I went next door to Love N Haight and ordered a huge sandwich drooling with sprouts.

But as soon as I caught a whiff of the freshly made slices from Mythic, I knew I'd made a mistake. My bf relucantly let me have a bite of his, and I have to say for late night food options, Mythic is by far, one of the best in the area. I could actually taste the toppings, the crust was doughy (the way I like it) and cheesy slice was piping steam.

I'm planning on birthing an additional star to this review - once I get a  big slice just to myself.
author: Jessica T.

description:
The city does not need more pizza joints where already made slices have been sitting in a warmer for hours. What the city does need more of are made to order slices like the ones from Mythic. Consider it your chance to build your dream slice. For me it was no cheese but plenty of veggies. My creation was healthy, gigantic and at $3.50, a very good deal.

Accept slice mediocrity as you wish. I'll be at Mythic.
author: Jason B.

description:
Popped in here for a quick slice at around 11pm. The dude behind the counter scared the hell out of me. I said, "two pepperonis." He stared back blankly, so I wasn't sure if he heard me. I said again, "two pepperonis." He muttered, "I heard you! Cash or card?!" I said, "CARD!" 

Pizza was ready in like 10-15 minutes. Nothing to right home about really, but it filled the belly.
author: Michael C.

description:
I don't care what you fools think about Mythic. They don't understand what it's like to have a Tijuana pizza when you really need it. Day or night or super late 'last call' night, Mythic is there for me.

The guys working there are always really nice to me. They take care of business and serve you a hot, freshly baked pizza within minutes. 

Think about it. You're drunk. It's 2am. A beautiful, florescent light and the wafts of fresh pizza is beaming you in from down Haight Street. You walk in and BAM 5 minutes later you're shoving a pizza with everything but the kitchen sink down your throat. It's warm. Savory. Full-filling your drunken needs. You ORDER A SECOND and they don't even judge you. Yeah, it's like that.

It's like having a cheap and dirty mistress that always answers her phone late at night, no matter what.
author: Michelle N.

description: yep, best drunk pizza. combo slice was delicious. great they are open late, went here after Ruby Skye
author: Ellie B.

description:
The cheese they use is really really gooey, plus the pizza crust is super thin so it seems like these folks are giving you more pizza than crust. My friends and I came by here on a weekday, so I don't know what the rest of these negative yelpers are talking about with drunken folks coming by. Seating is limited, pizza is delicious, and anyone else that posted pictures... That's EXACTLY what the slices look like.

I'd definitely come by for another slice next time i'm in the area.
author: Jay A.

description: I came here and the pizza was pretty good. Haven't been to many small pizzeria, but it was amazing. I enjoyed. I was drunk but it was great
author: Trey L.

description:
I have got to hand it to Mythic Pizza for having such a good business plan! They are so smart for posting up next to Toronado (a bar). Drunk people love eating pizza! We come here all the time after enjoying a few beers next door. 

I like the Athens pizza. It has pesto, artichoke hearts and garlic. The chunks of artichoke hearts are HUGE.  

I'm pretty sure the pizza tastes extra good because I'm intoxicated, but there's nothing better than a greasy slice of pizza to sober you up.
author: Patricia L.

description:
Pretty good pizza. I remember it being better at 2 a.m. The pesto slice is pretty damn good. Very bready/cheesey pizza. If you're into that sort of thing, then it's good. If not... try somewhere else.
Pretty reasonable prices, too. $15 for a large cheese that's 10 slices...Share with friends for good, cheap drunk munchies.
author: christine c.

description: We were in town a couple of months ago for a concert, and this place was one of the only places open afterwards. We decided to try it & were pleasantly surprised - the pizza was great! The only downside was the tight quarters & some strange company while waiting for our pizza to get done - but I'm sure that's not out of the ordinary for San Francisco!
author: Britnie R.

description: Fresh cheese slice covered in garlic and hot sauce. Good crust. Solid late night snack.
author: Emily D.

description:
Stream of consciousness review of "Mythic" :

It was late (11 PM), had no dinner (working in a coal mine without stopping), was on Haight St ( is this where the Haighters live ?), needed food (not a lot of options at this hour) , saw Mythic ( I like myth's, never have had a Mythic pizza),  every table filled (ok, well,  there are a grand total of four), the miracle happens (yes Virginia, miracles can happen at pizza joints @ 11PM) - two Haightsters busy texting decided they had completed their mission (probably posting that they just had pizza) and left (hallelujah), friend grabs table (like making a "b" line for the cab in Manhattan) , order the "meat lovers" pie (wished it had more MEAT, cheese was good & gooey), pie landed on the counter fresh out of the oven with an announcement "Meat Lovers READY"  (this would have another meaning in another neighborhood), watch the Haighsters roam in and out with their coveted slice (must be the "go to" source for late night bites), watch one Haightster (more like a fatster) down a giant calzone (this was a wow moment.... "but to each their own"), survey the decor (another wow moment ... a giant gold colored track light with giant light cans, cheap posters on the walls, large windows to watch the Haight world meander or stumble by).

Would return for another Mythic experience, if I were in the same set of circumstances (see above).
author: Matsuo U.

description: I recently moved to Lower Haight and this was my first experience with Mythic Pizza. I ordered online through OrderAhead.com. The pizza was ready for pick-up in 20 minutes as promised. Unfortunately we didn't open the boxes there (lesson learned) and didn't realize they'd got the order wrong until we were home. When I called them to explain, the lovely owner apologized, told me that they are having trouble reading the online orders, and told me they make us a new pizza and rush it over to our door. Within 15 minutes we had a new, piping hot pizza made exactly how we wanted it. Even after all that, I'd say it was worth the wait. Very tasty pizza, loaded with quality toppings and crazy amounts of cheese. And because they don't do huge crusts, you get a lot of pizza. With that and the original mis-order, we'll be eating Mythic Pizza for days. I'm not complaining.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Truth be told, I've never been here sober. Luckily, Mythic Pizza is not the pizza joint for those San Francisco foodies looking for authentic Italian cuisine.  Nope.  It's the kind of place that hordes of drunken people, with only a few bucks left in their pockets, flock to after drinking heavily in the lower Haight.  

The service isn't stellar here.  Don't expect smiles and witty banter from the staff (if you had to deal with drunkards trying to order pizza every night you'd be a bit surly too), but they will get you your pizza as quickly as they can.

The pizza-by-the-slice selection here is pretty good.  I'm a fan of the Athens (pesto, artichoke hearts, & garlic), but they are all tasty.  The pizza crust is somewhere between regular and deep dish, so they'll be a lot of bread to help soak up that excess beer in your stomach.

BONUS TIP: You can take your pizza into Toronado next door.
author: Lara O.

description: Good old American pizza style - not deep like Chicago, not thin like NY, but just "normal" or even a little bit bigger like the types of pizza that's served at pizza food chains like Domino's...but obviously way better. I feel like it's hard to find that style of pizza but that tastes good; all the good pizza makers are focusing on making NY style or deep dish pizza! The ingredients are really fresh and high quality and it makes a world of difference. Yes, i was drinking beforehand, but still..
author: Sonya Z.

description:
Understand that you don't go here for good pizza.  You go here for late night sustenance.   A few slices, throw in some cokes and waters, We're good for hours.

Everybody there is drunk.  At the least.
author: Meg W.

description:
Two stars for being open after the bars let out, and being relatively cheap. Minus 3 stars for the damage this will do to your stomach. I come here once and a while when I've run out of other options for food, always thinking that it's alright pizza. Always wrong. 

If you're wasted and looking for some cheap fast pizza with some shit on it that'll keep you in the bathroom for hours, then come on down to Lower Haights finest.
author: Joe M.

description: Ok this is the neighborhood pizza place... and it's terrible. I always always end up making the mistake of coming here when I am really drunk and it's really late. Not to say I should be known for making great decisions in such a state, but damn. Crust is like cardboard, covered in cheese and it is almost sour to me. Sadly it's one of the few pizza places in the area open late. So it's got that going for it
author: Greg G.

description: Ive stopped by here several times for a late night slice. Ive had mixed results, but i keep coming back.
author: Lando H.

description:
Step 1)
Go to Toronado and order several amazing beers

Step 2)
Sumble next door to Mythic Pizza and have one slice. That probably won't be enough, so get a second.

Step 3)
Go back two steps.
author: David K.

description: Best freakn' calzone I've tasted in a long time. My mouth waters as I think of that super delicious San Francisco calzone I engulfed with pure glee. This was during a second visit. I remember coming here for the first time getting some sort of Veggie Pizza slice with garlic (my fave!) and that was to die for. I'm most definitely coming back here for my addictive fix of pizza, regardless of how many pizza places I pass by.
author: Maleia M.

description: I've gotten slices from here a few times. It's a little inconsistent: sometimes it's great, but a few times the pizza has been over or undercooked. But all in all it's good stuff and they are open late.
author: Tbone M.

description:
Went here instead because Rosamunde was closed for re-stocking :'( :'(

We got the Mythic (~*original*~ I know. See photo). It was decent... but I wanted my beer sausage *pouts*
author: S. D.

description:
This place is suitable for a quick cheap filling satisfaction + heart attack.

Their pizza's okay, nothing special. But for damn sure all i can really remember is it's HELLA greasy. i had to pat it to get most of the grease off with a napkin. 

But i do bet it taste real good when im drunk. =)
author: Tam T.

description:
Garbage. 

Theyre open late and located beside some bars, but thats still not a good enough excuse to go here, when Love n Haight deli is literally right next door, and open just as late. For almost the same price you can get a big-ass sandwich with all the fillings at Love n Haight.

Suck it.
author: Brendan M.

description:
Im not sure why people love this place? I LOVE me some pizza from any and everywhere (usually)! But this place didnt do anything for me. They are generous with their toppings but its so generous that it slides off the pizza which means its so heavy that the dough cant support it. I've been there 3 times when I first lived in lower haight because my roommates raved about it... but honestly... everytime I was there... I became pissed off that I spent my money and had to throw the pizza out! YUP... and I dont condone throwing any food away... so that should give you a picture of how I feel. 

Maybe its because people are crazy drunk when they eat it that makes it a favorite of lower haight-ers... not sure. Sorry Mythic... I gave you guys a chance.
author: roderick h.

description: This is a great late night drunk spot, but I've also eaten here for dinner many times.  They have tons of great options and their sandwiches and non pizza options are also pretty good.  I discovered their wings which are AMAZING and now i have to get them every time.  They do take longer than a slice though.
author: Julie B.

description: I love this place! Every time I go to San Fran I gotta have it. The pricing is pretty good for a nice big piece of pizza that will def fill you up. Try the "San Francisco", so yummy!!!! :) Workers have always been nice and fast.
author: Myrinda A.

description:
My bf has been raving about their pesto pizza for 1 month so to finally shut him up, I decided to see how good their pesto pizza really is.

We drove down to the Lower Haight in the late afternoon (1:30 PMish) and once we entered the typical, quaint pizza joint, the bf ordered 2 pesto slices ($3/slice) without a second glace at the menu. When we arrived, there was nobody else there and the wait was about 5 min. for our piping hot slice of pesto pizza.

The slice was average sized and thin (not as thin as Pizzetta 211 though) and the dough was light and just toasted/crispy enough for me to keep on eating it. The pesto was artistically drizzled on top of the cheese and the slice itself was so good, I couldn't stop eating it. I found the pesto pizza different from Nizario's in that I think the pesto is baked in the oven whereas at Mythic, they drizzle the pesto on the pizza, after it has been cooked. I prefer the latter. I just wish that they poured on the pesto...rather than lightly drizzling it!
author: Janel Y.

description: I love this place. The pizza is tasty, quick and very reasonably priced...and it's right next to Toronado. I have The Haight more than any other slice, just a great all round place. The guy behind the counter is always friendly & he'll answer any question happily.
author: Robert B.

description:
Once I lowered my standards and accepted that fact that pizza in San Francisco generally sucks, I was able to start to enjoy places like Mythc Pizza. 

It isn't really that good, but its not horrible. 

I'm giving it 3 stars thinking from the mind of a drunk and stoned person late at night.

If i was sober and it was the middle of the day, it would probably be two stars.
author: Meowy C.

description: living in wa. now, it's been a long time since i've been here.meaning it's been a long time since i've been home! stopping here for a slice of the athens or two after deathguild onmondays and often b4 fishing nocnoc for a onenightr/week stand was a ritual of habit in the 90's both when and after i lived on the lowerhaight!1 you might as well, after clubs,drinks& drugs what else this good can you afford?  /alexavier
author: Alexavier S.

description:
Do you want the shIts ????

Do you want to spend another $7 on a bottle of Pepto Bismol ????

Do you want dribbling tomato juice (ketchup) dripping on your shirt while you eat ????

If you answered 'YES' to any of the above questions, then you should definitely eat here. Otherwise I would pass. This place is SO WEAK. Only drunk people stumbling out of Molotov's go here. Trust me. Tons of way better places.

If you're starving, go to Rosamunde next door. That place is the BOMB!
author: Rouz E.

description: Here's the deal with SF pizza.  With such great places such as escape, zero zero, etc, people act like any pizza less than gourmet is a sin.  I, respectfully disagree.  I think there is definitely a time and a place for middle of the road, fast, hot pizza slice.  And that is exactly what mythic is.  It's there when you need it, no surprises, exactly what you expect.  It's medium quality cheese, over medium quality sauce, on medium quality dough.  It's cheap, fast, and after a long night, can be an absolute godsend.  I can't count how many times I've been driving or biking home from a show or work and decided to stop in for a big hot slice or two.   If I had to make a complaint..it's this.  Sometime they have these bottles or red sauce.  Now most of the time, it's buffalo sauce, and it's absolutely glorious.  HOWEVER, sometimes they must run out or something, and they replace it with tapatillo.  Now tapatillo is good, but the combo of buffalo sauce on a slice of cheese, is something that should never be fucked with.  So I always have to do a smell test so I don't accidentally dump a bunch of the wrong sauce on my slice.  Good times.
author: Nick T.

description:
i like to stop here for a slice if im feeling lazy about making dinner and cheap about buying an actual meal. 

their slices are HUGJE! i usually go for the Tijuana or Haight sans meat. They make each slice to-order so dont be afraid to be picky. 

if you like yr pizza well done, make sure to request it that way. 
Its not as bad as Rouz E makes it out to be, but for $5, itll fill yr belly whether yr drunk, lazy or are ok with experiencing ok pizza.
author: Jenny C.

description:
Mythic Pizza,
You are so hit or miss in your food quality.Yesterday the sauce was oddly sweet, and the cheese was far too sparse.  If it weren't for your low prices, internet ordering options and delivery to my neighborhood ( in a timely manner I must add) I probably wouldn't order your pizza and meatball subs any longer. your calzones are delicious but hard to order for two when one person is a picky eater (not me of course.)
I will still enlist your pizza services, I just wish you could be more consistent in your food quality.
author: Kelle K.

description:
HOLD THE PHONE!

Still drunk food.
Still line out the door after last call.
Still mostly made for the purposes of absorbing alcohol.
But...

... in yet another bumbling, laughter-filled, sloppy end of a drunk evening, i got desperate and went back (even though i know i do NOT like this pizza) and I discovered that they have a vegan pizza. We ordered a whole pie, with very low (drunk) expectations. You know what? It was actually pretty damn good! 

The quality was proven the following day, when sober. It's spinach, artichoke hearts, minced garlic, and sauce. Does this mean their cheap cheese is what makes the regular pizza so horrible? Despite my previous disdain, I'm going to get it again. But only when I'm drunk.
author: Stumbalina b.

description:
Pizza isn't bad, but I'm constantly let down by their poor delivery. Just had a massive problem with them. They "said" they called my phone when they were outside, but I didn't receive any calls from them. I have now been waiting for my pizza for almost 2 hours.

To top it off, I tried calling them for about 40 minutes, NO ANSWERS AT ALL! WHAT THE FUCK MYTHIC?!
author: Matthew M.

description: Don't go there expecting actual pizza deliciousness. Got burned a second time while ordering a simple pepperoni. Their toppings seem to slide off before I could even eat it, letting me know the ingredients (sauce, cheese?) Are of extremely low quality.
author: Samantha S.

description: Thank you, Arab and Mexican group of men. The pizza is delicious and you are very very graceful at handling drunk customers. Thank you for the amazing slice of Hawaiian with Jalapeno :)
author: Maryam M.

description:
With all due respect to "Joshua WW.", get a life.

If you want snob pizza, take your designer clothes, pay a bundle and hit North Beach.  We don't need you in Lower Haight.  This is good pizza, offered by the slice.  It's hand-thrown dough, not too thick and not too thin, cooked correctly, AND REALLY, REALLY CHEAP!!

You can get a really tasty huge slice of cheese pizza here for 2.50.  Get off your snob wagon and get with the good eats.
author: Gary N.

description:
The pizza is pretty good.  I had a slice with feta cheese, olives, pepperoni, and sausage.  The ingredients were incredibly fresh and the slice wasn't soaked in oil.  Maybe the quality of their pizza varies throughout the day, but I'll take it any day over the generic pizza chains.  

The ambiance of the place left a lot of be desired but it's a fun place to people watch.
author: Christina L.

description: Everything taste delicious when you're drunk. Convenient spot to buy pizza, random bars down the street. Nothing special just good pizza and service.
author: Shakei D.

description: This has been the only bad experience my wife and I had in San Francisco. My wife went in by herself to order a slice of pizza and had only a debit card. An older man helped her with her transaction and was nothing but rude to her. He was short with her when she asked questions, made no eye contact and was was overall not thankful for the business. At the time of payment, and as is sometimes usual, there was a fee for using a debit card, however there was a mandatory "Customary Tip" of at least $1.00, PLUS when you use a debit card they do NOT provide a receipt. She specifically asked for one and he refused to provide one to her. On top of it all, the quality of food was not worth the bad service provided by this company.
author: Anthony R.

description:
It brought me back to the college days of Fat Slice and Blondies in Berkeley..

Hot pizza with stringy melted cheese and a crisped thin crust... pesto pizza at 3am after the club... that is all  :)
author: Marilyn H.

description:
I can't tell you how many times Mythic Pizza has saved us from going hungry during 4th meal.  Let's just say it's been many many times.

It's definitely one of those spots that's not super clean or roomy, and you have a chance to see a drug deal on the street, but I can't imagine grabbing a slice anywhere else.
author: Brad J.

description:
Open after bars close? Yes
Right next door to two badass bars? Yes
Do I eat it when completely sober? Yes!
Do they make it when you order it? Yes
Is every bite pesto, garlicy heaven? Yes
Would I eat it every day if I lived in Lower Haight? Yes
Would I do a voluntary commercial for them? maybe
author: Brandon H.

description: The pizza we got taste like heaven. Thick cheese, thick fresh chewy bread.  Unfortunately we live in Australia and we could only dream about tasting it again. I wonder how much it would cost to deliver it to perth.  Mmm
